Preventive Care and Screening: Influenza Immunization for Patients >= 50 Years Old (NQF 0041)

eMeasure Name Preventive Care and Screening: Influenza Immunization for Patients >= 50 Years Old eMeasure Id E695FFE1-7BB3-47CD-808F-82823336F210
Version number 1 eMeasure Set Id F3CEEED6-D979-441A-9CF2-8EF1D4A65FA3
Available Date No information Measurement Period January 1, 20xx through December 31, 20xx
Measure Steward American Medical Association - Physician Consortium for Performance Improvement
Endorsed by National Quality Forum
Description Percentage of patients aged 50 years and older who received an influenza immunization during the flu season (September through February)
Copyright 
© 2010 American Medical Association.  All Rights Reserved
Measure scoring Proportion
Measure type Process
Stratification 
None
Risk Adjustment 
None
Data Aggregation 

            

            

               Rationale
               
Influenza vaccination has shown to decrease hospitalizations for influenza, especially for those with risk factors, however annual influenza vaccination rates remain low.

            

            

               Clinical Recommendation Statement
               
Annual influenza immunization is recommended for all groups who are at increased risk for complications from influenza including persons aged >= 50 years. (CDC, USPSTF)

            

            

               Improvement notation
               
Higher score indicates better quality

            

            

               Measurement duration
               
12 month(s)

            

            

               Reference
               
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.  Prevention and control of influenza:  recommendations of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP), 2008.  MMWR Early Release 2008;July17:1-60.

            

            

               Reference
               
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.  Prevention and control of influenza:  recommendations of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP), 2009.  MMWR 2009;58(No, RR-8):1-52

            

            

               Definition
               
Initial Patient Population(s): Patient Age:  Patients aged 50 years and older at the beginning of the measurement period. Diagnosis Active:  There is no diagnosis associated with this measure. Encounter:  At least 2 visits (or at least 1 preventive medicine visit) with the physician, physician's assistant, or nurse practitioner during the measurement period

            

            

               Definition
               
Denominator(s): All patients aged 50 years and older seen for an encounter during the flu season

            

            

               Definition
               
Denominator Exclusion(s): N/A

            

            

               Definition
               
Numerator(s): Patients who received an influenza immunization during the flu season (September through February)

            

            

               Definition
               
Denominator Exception(s): Documentation of medical reason(s) for patient not receiving the influenza immunization (eg, allergy, other medical reason) Documentation of patient reason(s) for patient not receiving the influenza immunization (eg, patient declined) Documentation of system reason(s) for patient not receiving the influenza immunization (eg, vaccine not available)

            

            

               Guidance
               
The timeframe for the "Encounter: Influenza" in the Denominator, refers to the influenza season defined by the measure: September through February (after August 31 for the year prior to the measurement year and before March 1 during the measurement year).

            

            

               Supplemental Data Elements
               
Report "Patient Characteristic: Gender" using "Gender HL7 Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.1)"; Report "Patient Characteristic: Race" using "Race CDC Value Set (2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.836)"; Report "Patient Characteristic: Ethnicity" using "Ethnicity CDC Value Set (2.16.840.1.114222.4.11.837)"; Report "Patient Characteristic: Payer" using "Payer Source of Payment Typology Value Set (2.16.840.1.113883.3.221.5)".

        • OR: "Encounter: Encounter Prev Med 40 and Older"
